Posts.Content: Sadlynew2018 wrote: hello everyone! Hoping someone could lend some guidance or insight into what I'm experiencing. Last Thursday, I had my second weekly infusion of taxol. Didn't have any allergic reactions during the infusion. Starting last week, I had shortness of breath and as the days passed, my chest felt tighter and I had upper back pain. Yesterday, I felt like I was having a heart attack. I went to the ER this morning. They gave me a full workout. CT of chest was clear. I go for a heart stress test in the morning. I'm reading the symptoms of allergic reactions to taxol and I feel like I have them, except delayed? I'm 41 and never had back pain in my life. The pain I feel in my back is excruciating. The doctors can't figure out what's wrong between my chest and my back. Any similar experiences Dx 8/9/2018, IDC, Right, 1cm, Stage IA, Grade 2, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Surgery 8/27/2018 Lymph node removal: Sentinel; Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Dx 9/5/2018, IDC, Right, 3cm, Grade 3, 1/15 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Surgery 9/9/2018 Lymph node removal: Underarm/Axillary Chemotherapy 10/8/2018 AC + T (Taxol) Radiation Therapy 3/18/2019 Whole-breast: Breast, Lymph nodes, Chest wall Hormonal Therapy 4/4/2019 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Hormonal Therapy Zoladex (goserelin) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Sadlynew2018 wrote: I can’t get a real clear answer on what this is and how much it factors into things re prognosis. All I’ve read is how it corresponds to a poor prognosis (Dr google strikes again). The internet makes it sound like a death sentence. Ugh. Are there women out there with LVI that have good stories? I know, Dr Google is the enemy.
